-e ---

# deem obdúmat DOM doom <> don

𒁮 dam deem "believe" ≈ 𒌓 TAM τῑμάω tīmáō “honour” "to trust; to believe"

𒁶𒈠 𒁆𒈠 dimma #ţēmu dämmer denk deem

𒁲𒉏 di-nim 𒁲𒉏 deeming, legal case

𒁲𒉆 di-nam 𒁲𒉆 deeming, legal decision

𒁕𒀀𒀀𒉡𒌝 daʸa-a-nu-um dayyānum 𒁕𒀀𒀀𒉡𒌝 deen, judge

𓄣𓏤 | think | ment > vermeinen, vermuten
𓄣𓏤 | think | ment > miettiä ⇔ ду́мати dúmaty уду́мати udúmaty обду́мывать obdúmyvat обду́мать obdúmat ⇔ deem !!

𓂧 𓋬 | pronounce, proclaim (name), mention, be renowned | deem <> δym com

𓄔 𓅓 𓀀 #sḏmw •s'deemer esteemer⇔ estimate
𓄔 𓅓 𓀀 #sḏmw •s'deemer < ⲥⲱⲧⲉⲙ
𓅓 𓄔 𓀀 𓏪 | judge, hearers | Dom™
𓊃 𓆓 𓅓 𓄔 | ⲥⲱⲧⲉⲙ | hear

𓌷 𓂝 𓏏 𓏮 𓆄 𓆄 𓆗 𓆗 | (dual) judgement | deem doom 𐌳𐍉𐌼𐍃 dōms reverse

𒁲𒉡 di-nu
𒁲𒉡 decision, legal deeming

𒁲𒉡𒁕𒉡 di-nu da-nu
𒁲𒉡𒁕𒉡 to pass verdict

𒁴 DIM 𒁴𒈬 tim-mu Turm = post, pillar, pole; (legal) binding, bond, knot ⇔ deam sym

𒋫 𒍑 𒋫 ta-us₂-ta Testament law

𒌤𒂊𒈬𒊓 de-e-mu-sa the-news (of…) <> deem
